ygData.subject: Re: Got 50, met Nagafen, lost 50...
ygData.msgSnippet: I have yet to take a character over 15, so I probably shouldn t be responding to this post, but I m bored and wanted someone to talk to . ;)  I don t play
ygData.messageBody:
I have yet to take a character over 15, so I probably shouldn't be
responding to this post, but I'm bored and wanted 'someone to talk to'.
;) I don't play very much, and I used to be a roleplayer extreme. I
took my main character, Sara, gave her a great story line, including the
reason a Wood Elf had a human name, and then decided to roleplay it
out... which meant re-starting her with her Elven name so that when the
original character completed a certain quest, she would earn the right
to be called by her Elven name. So I stopped Sara at 15 and started
this one (Aelwesara), who is currently 13. So, if I think of how
serious an effort my online partner and I have put into getting my new
one up to 13... I could have been level 25, 26? Maybe higher? <sighs>

But I'm having fun, and indulging what I like best. If I never get a
character higher than 20, and I am still enjoying myself, I'll consider
my ten bucks a month well-spent.
=)

Sara/Aelwesara, Povar
Valdaya, Rallos Zek

judy wrote:

> Okay, making 20 isn't THAT hard for me. I have a 22 wizard, a 19
> Druid, and a 16 Cleric. My problem is that boredom sets. It takes
> forever to earn experience and one death can take away hours and hours
> of playtime gaining that experience. The equipment is extremely
> exepensive IF you can find it, and the places where you can get good
> loot drops are heavily camped. Kill Stealing is not a game I like to
> play, though my wizard is very good at it *grin*.
>
> How do you get past the boredom at 20 stage enough to move forward
> into the higher levels where there isn't so much overcamping and
> competition?
>
